title: Ticket #4504: Concurrency test extension - sequential job submition
description:
We suspect a bug with static concurrency limits. The idea was to submit slower towards a configured limit. However SimpleJob::RunCheck does not return until all the queue request complete and with sleep forever jobs, how do you submit additional jobs slowly, and with the same submit file and callbacks?

The solution was to provide a callback so RunCheck can give you the name of the submit file it is creating. Then for each extra job you fork a child to call RunTest passing the testname and the submit file which gets you the same callbacks.

Note this means you can not do things in callbacks with counters! In these tests we examine run queue for running and idle tests. The is a main callback in the parent which repeats evry 10 seconds as things change.

We configure a hash and a taskname for each part of the tests adding as the value the number of additional jobs desired and the parents callback kicks them off, one per callback.

ToDo All six tests are currently in slow submit mode due to a suspected bug with static slots and currency greater then one when jobs are submitted queue N. Once resolved, we'l do queue N submits and sequental(current mode)

At this point job_concurrency_limitsS.run displays the issue fairly quickly in queue mode. Set $burst == 1 near top to flip to queue N submits.
